channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Wet dog fouling besides a tree which is in front of 87-89 Fernhead Road., 29th August
item.description:
Wet dog fouling besides a tree which is in front 87-89 Fernhead Road. And there is extreme birds droppings on the pavement besides the bus shelter that is in front of 120 - 122 Fernhead Road. The pavement has turned black because of the vast birds droppings. I have mentioned this to you before over the past few weeks. However, so far nothing has been done! Thank you in anticipation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Tree Stump Spikes, 29th August
item.description:
W3w///palms.went.monday The small avenue of new trees, along the footpath from the obelisk to the canal, appears to have been badly strimmed ripping off the bark and killing the trees. At least four have died leaving sharp 9 inch spikes protruding from the grass which could be dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79, Seymour Villas, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crossing fairhazel greencroft, 29th August
item.description:
Every time it rains there is a huge puddle How do you expect people to take on cycling in those conditions I always have to take the sidewalk as the cycling path is FLOODED
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Fairhazel Gardens, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Asian hornets, 29th August
item.description:
There is a nest of what looks like Asian hornets forming in the dead limb scar of an oak tree off the pathway in danson park at the location shown. Enter the gate via lakeside close, walk approx 75 yards to the first live oak tree set back off the road on the right, they hornets are nesting in a limb scar approx 8 feet off the ground facing the road. There is a potential danger to park users walking past as there is a lot of hornet activity around the new nest

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lakeside Close, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox in the bushes of communal garden of flats in Victoria street. Fox is in bushes to the left hand side near the wall. There’s a discarded cushion and blanket near it., 29th August
item.description:
Left hand side of communal garden in flats of Victoria street DA17 a small dead fox is in the bushes, fairly concealed but dogs and flies are finding it. It’s been there a couple of days. There’s an old cushion and blanket discarded under the bushes near it. Fox is to the left of these against the wall with leaves over it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Street, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking in the road, 29th August
item.description:
Using the rd for parking it's reduced the two lane to one Can this be sorted we as residence are fed up With 3-4 cars blocking the rd thank you looking forward to the action required to achieve back the highway rd

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beaulieu Avenue, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish Left by Rough Sleepers Not Being Cleaned - Recurring Issue, 29th August
item.description:
I’m writing to report that there is often rubbish left on the ground by rough sleepers in the area, and unfortunately it’s not being cleaned up. The mess has been there for quite some time now and doesn’t seem to be part of the regular cleaning routine. While I understand the complexity of the situation, the ongoing presence of trash on the floor is creating serious hygiene and cleanliness issues for residents. It’s also making the area look very neglected. Could you please arrange for a clean-up and ensure this is monitored more regularly?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Bell Yard Mews, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
